Package socialmedia

Class SocialMedia

  • java.lang.Object
    • socialmedia.SocialMedia
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, MiniSocialMediaPlatform, SocialMediaPlatform
    public class SocialMedia
extends java.lang.Object
implements SocialMediaPlatform
    This class is am implimetation of the SocialMediaPlatform interface which extends the MiniSocialMediaPlatform interface. Therefore it is resposible for most of the functionality of the platform.

    A SocialMedia object has a list of all accounts and a list of all posts which is used to hold all data on the Social Media Platform. The accounts, posts, endorsments and comments in these lists are then created, removed an edisted using the methods in the class.

    The class itself also has a static value for its SerialVersionUID used when serializing the platform.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • createAccount

        public int createAccount​(java.lang.String handle)
                  throws IllegalHandleException,
                         InvalidHandleException
        This method allows the user to create an account with just their handle and it returns their id number afterwards. It does the checks on the handle to ensure that there are no other users with the same handle, the handle is under 30 characters, is not empty and finally that it has no white space.
        Specified by:
        createAccount in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
        Parameters:
        handle - This is the handle the user wants to use
        Returns:
        This returns the id of the new account.
        Throws:
        IllegalHandleException - Thrown if the handle is already in use by another user.
        InvalidHandleException - Thrown if the handle is over 30 chars, is empty or has white space.

      • createAccount

        public int createAccount​(java.lang.String handle,
                         java.lang.String description)
                  throws IllegalHandleException,
                         InvalidHandleException
        This method allows the user to create an account with the handle and description. It does checks to ensure the handle is valid and not already in use within the system.
        Specified by:
        createAccount in interface SocialMediaPlatform
        Parameters:
        handle - The handle of the new user.
        description - The description to be displayed on the profile.
        Returns:
        This returns the id of the new account.
        Throws:
        IllegalHandleException - Thrown if the handle is already in use by another user.
        InvalidHandleException - Thrown if the handle is over 30 chars, is empty or has white space.

        Throws:

      • createPost

        public int createPost​(java.lang.String handle,
                      java.lang.String message)
               throws HandleNotRecognisedException,
                      InvalidPostException
        This method impliments the SocialMediaPlatform method createPost by creating a post for the account identified by the given handle with the following message.
        Specified by:
        createPost in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
        Parameters:
        handle - The handle of the account the post is associated with.
        message - The message associated with the post.
        Returns:
        The sequential ID of the created post.
        Throws:
        HandleNotRecognisedException - Thrown If the handle does not match to any account in the system.
        InvalidPostException - Thrown if the message is empty or has more than 100 characters.

      • endorsePost

        public int endorsePost​(java.lang.String handle,
                       int id)
                throws HandleNotRecognisedException,
                       PostIDNotRecognisedException,
                       NotActionablePostException
        This method impliments the SocialMediaPlatform method endorsePost by creating an endorsement post of an existing post, similar to a retweet on Twitter. An endorsement post is a special post. It contains a reference to the endorsed post and its message is formatted as:

        "EP@" + [endorsed account handle] + ": " + [endorsed message]

        Specified by:
        endorsePost in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
        Parameters:
        handle - The handle of the account associated with the endorsement.
        id - The id of the post associated with the endorsement.
        Returns:
        The sequencial ID of the created endorsement.
        Throws:
        HandleNotRecognisedException - Thrown when the handle is not associated with a account on the platform.
        PostIDNotRecognisedException - Thrown when the post id is not associated with a post on the platform.
        NotActionablePostException - Thrown when attempting to act upon a non actionabe post.

      • commentPost

        public int commentPost​(java.lang.String handle,
                       int id,
                       java.lang.String message)
                throws HandleNotRecognisedException,
                       PostIDNotRecognisedException,
                       NotActionablePostException,
                       InvalidPostException
        This method impliments the SocialMediaPlatform method commentPost by creating a comment post referring to an existing post, similarly to a reply on Twitter. A comment post is a special post. It contains a reference to the post being commented upon.
        Specified by:
        commentPost in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
        Parameters:
        handle - The handle of the account associated with the endorsement.
        id - The id of the post associated with the endorsement.
        message - The message conatined in the comment.
        Returns:
        The sequencial ID of the created comment.
        Throws:
        HandleNotRecognisedException - Thrown when the handle is not associated with a account on the platform.
        PostIDNotRecognisedException - Thrown when the post id is not associated with a post on the platform.
        NotActionablePostException - Thrown when attempting to act upon a non actionabe post.
        InvalidPostException - Thrown if the message is empty or has more than 100 characters.

      • deletePost

        public void deletePost​(int id)
                throws PostIDNotRecognisedException
        This method impliments the deletePost method of the MiniSocialMediaPlatform interface by removing the post from the platform. When a post is removed, all its endorsements should be removed as well. All replies to this post should be updated by replacing the reference to this post by a generic empty post.

        The generic empty post message should be "The original content was removed from the system and is no longer available.". This empty post is just a replacement placeholder for the post which a reply refers to. Empty posts should not be linked to any account and cannot be acted upon, i.e., it cannot be available for endorsements or replies.

        Specified by:
        deletePost in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the post to be displayed.
        Throws:
        PostIDNotRecognisedException - Thrown when the post id is not associated with a post on the platform.

      • showIndividualPost

        public java.lang.String showIndividualPost​(int id)
                                    throws PostIDNotRecognisedException
        This method impliments the showIndividualPost method by finding the Post which coresponds with the given post ID and the getting the descirption from the post's toString method. The format is as follows: 
         ID: [post ID]
 Account: [account handle]
 No. endorsements: [number of endorsements received by the post] | No. comments: [number of comments received by the post]
 [post message]
        Specified by:
        showIndividualPost in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the post to be displayed.
        Returns:
        The description of the Post.
        Throws:
        PostIDNotRecognisedException - Thrown when the post id is not associated with a post on the platform.

      • showPostChildrenDetails

        public java.lang.StringBuilder showPostChildrenDetails​(int id)
                                                throws PostIDNotRecognisedException,
                                                       NotActionablePostException
        This method impliments the showPostChildrenDetails of the MiniSocialMediaPlatform interface by building a StringBuilder showing the details of the current post and all its children posts. See interface for further details.
        Specified by:
        showPostChildrenDetails in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
        Parameters:
        id - The id of the post to be shown.
        Returns:
        A formatted StringBuilder containing the details of the post and its children.
        Throws:
        PostIDNotRecognisedException - Thrown if the ID does not match to any post in the system.
        NotActionablePostException - Thrown if the ID refers to an endorsement post. Endorsement posts do not have children since they are not endorsable nor commented.

      • addPostChildrenDetails

        public void addPostChildrenDetails​(java.lang.StringBuilder postDetails,
                                   Comment[] comments,
                                   int numTabs)
                            throws PostIDNotRecognisedException
        This is method which uses recurssion to display the posts and all the sub-posts.
        Parameters:
        postDetails - The StringBuilder to add the posts details to.
        comments - The comments to loop over adding them to the BuildString and recursively calling the method again for any subcomments.
        numTabs - The number of tabs to add for this set of comments.
        Throws:
        PostIDNotRecognisedException - Thrown if the ID does not match to any post in the system.

      • getNumberOfAccounts

        public int getNumberOfAccounts()
        This method is an implimentation of the getNumberAccounts method in the SocialMediaPlatform interface by returning the current total number of accounts present in the platform. Note, this is NOT the total number of accounts ever created since the current total should discount deletions.
        Specified by:
        getNumberOfAccounts in interface SocialMediaPlatform
        Returns:
        The total number of accounts in the platform.

      • getTotalOriginalPosts

        public int getTotalOriginalPosts()
        This method is an implimentation of the getTotalOriginalPosts method in the SocialMediaPlatform interface by returning the current total number of original posts (i.e., disregarding endorsements and comments) present in the platform. Note, this is NOT the total number of posts ever created since the current total should discount deletions.
        Specified by:
        getTotalOriginalPosts in interface SocialMediaPlatform
        Returns:
        The total number of original posts in the platform.

      • getTotalEndorsmentPosts

        public int getTotalEndorsmentPosts()
        This method is an implimentation of the getTotalEndorsementPost method in the SocialMediaPlatform interface by returning the current total number of endorsement posts present in the platform. Note, this is NOT the total number of endorsements ever created since the current total should discount deletions.
        Specified by:
        getTotalEndorsmentPosts in interface SocialMediaPlatform
        Returns:
        The total number of endorsement posts in the platform.

      • getTotalCommentPosts

        public int getTotalCommentPosts()
        This method is an implimentation of the getTotalCommentPosts method in the SocialMediaPlatform interface by returning the current total number of comments posts present in the platform. Note, this is NOT the total number of comments ever created since the current total should discount deletions.
        Specified by:
        getTotalCommentPosts in interface SocialMediaPlatform
        Returns:
        The total number of comments posts in the platform.

      • getMostEndorsedPost

        public int getMostEndorsedPost()
        This method implients the getMostEndorsedPost method in the MiniSocialMediaPlatform iterface by identifing and returning the post with the most number of endorsements, a.k.a. the most popular post.

        If the method returns -1 then it means there are no Posts in the platform.

        Specified by:
        getMostEndorsedPost in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
        Returns:
        The ID of the most popular post.

      • getMostEndorsedAccount

        public int getMostEndorsedAccount()
        This method allows the user to retrieve the account with most endorsements. It loops over every account within the system and checks over all their posts to see how many endorsements each user has.

        If the method returns -1 then it means there are no Accounts in the platform.

        Specified by:
        getMostEndorsedAccount in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
        Returns:
        It returns the Id of the account with the most endorsements on the platform.

      • erasePlatform

        public void erasePlatform()
        This method impliments the erasePlatform method in the MiniSocialMediaPlatform interface by emptying this SocialMediaPlatform of its contents and resets all internal counters in Account and Post.
        Specified by:
        erasePlatform in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform

                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method impliments the savePlatform method in the MiniSocialMediaPlatform interace by saving this SocialMediaPlatform's contents into a serialised file, with the filename given in the argument.
        Specified by:
        savePlatform in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
        Parameters:
        filename - The path and name of the file to be saved to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is a problem experienced when trying to save the store contents to the file.

      • loadPlatform

        public void loadPlatform​(java.lang.String filename)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        This method impliments the loadPlatform method in the MiniSocialMediaPlatform interface by loading and replacing this SocialMediaPlatform's contents with the serialised contents stored in the file given in the argument.
        Specified by:
        loadPlatform in interface MiniSocialMediaPlatform
        Parameters:
        filename - The location of the file to be loaded.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there is a problem experienced when trying to load the store contents from the file.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - Thrown if required class files cannot be found when loading.
